Making and Knowing
A minimal edition of BnF Ms Fr 640

[TOC] | [diplomatic]

- - - - - 102r - - - - -

Provisions for the work of Colchos

7 limbecks of glasse 2 lbs. of ☿ One measure of coarse salt 6 unleaded earthenware vessel 2 large unleaded pots for calcinating 2 alembics to distill vinegar 4 pots of good vinegar 3 or 4 lamps 2 lbs. of cotton One pair of scissors

For the furnace

A chest with a ten inch wide square stone, and of a one—foot thickness, pierced in the middle 2 boxes or two earthenware pots with a lid 2 small pipes of white iron to evacuate the smoke of the furnace Turnipseed oil for the lamps to heat the furnace A fire—steel

Royal cement

One pound & a half of vitriol As much saltpeter As much rock alum

Glass vessel

The glass vessel must be either pear—shaped or round pyramid—shaped, of the same thickness as the small back of a knife, round on the bottom without folding over on itself, like flasks, its opening of such a size that a Dutch feather can just about get in, & with a lip at the end, in this way of the height of seven fingers’ width. > Figure > at bottom margin >
